Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice with cul; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; two added red bands; exterior: in handle zone, dotted concentric circles between lines; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the pattern, see British Museum 1924,1201.521. Lemos places this sherd in the Group of Chalices with Dotted Concentric Circles because of the decoration around the handle zone and between the handles (Lemos 1991, 70).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 239, no. 196)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0112) (phase 2)
